items.title: Perform analysis to support decision on use of hard/soft/transitional boundaries

details.content: **Hard boundaries**: geological faults, lithological contacts, sharp mineralization edges
**Soft boundaries**: gradational alteration zones, diffuse mineralization
**Transitional boundaries**: weathering profiles, gradual grade transitions

items.title: Check for substantial differences in anisotropy and ranges

details.content: Lag distance: typically 1/2 to 1/3 of drill spacing
Geometric anisotropy: different ranges, same sill
Combined anisotropy: both range and sill vary
Spherical: most common, linear near origin
Exponential: smoother, gradual approach to sill
Gaussian: very smooth, parabolic near origin
Power: for non-stationary data (avoid if possible)
Rule of thumb: Â¼ to Â½ of the nominal drillhole spacing

items.title: Rule of thumb is Â¼ to Â½ of the nominal drillhole spacing
